DataElement.preferredName: Esophageal Malignant Neoplasm Proximal Extent Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the proximal distance or extent of an esophageal malignant neoplasm.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the proximal (situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin) extent (the range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance) of an esophageal (of or relating to the esophagus) malignant neoplasm (a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the esophagus.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the esophagus.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Proximal; situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: Situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the measurement of the extent of an esophageal malignant neoplasm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ValueDomain.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
